Knowledge and understanding of: Correct coding initiative, revenue codes, DRG guidelines, ICD -9/10, CPTs, modifiers & HCPCs codes.

Job Description: Job Description   The OP Coder is responsible for assigning diagnostic and procedural codes (outpatient ancillary records and emergency department) to patient charts, of low to moderate complexity, using: ICD-10-CM, CPT and HCPCS or any other designated coding classification system in accordance with coding rules and regulations. They abide by the Standards of Ethical Coding as set forth by AHIMA. The OP Coder is also responsible for abstracting clinical and other data elements into the medical record.Knowledge, skills and abilitiesProficient in outpatient diagnosis coding guidelinesProficient in CPT/HCPCS code assignment including Evaluation & Management facility coding guidelinesAbility to assign corresponding PCS codes (after dates of service 10/1/2014) preferred but not requiredWorking knowledge of the Outpatient Prospective Payment System (OPPS)Adept at comparing documentation, code assignment and charge in the financial system for accuracy and completeness and elevating concerns to the appropriate managerFunctional knowledge of facility EMR, encoder and other support softwareAbility to establish and maintain effective working relationships as required by the duties of the positionAbility to concentrate and accomplish tasks with explicit accuracyAbility to use office equipment and automated systems/applications/software at an acceptable level of proficiencyQualificationsOne year of experience performing outpatient medical record coding in acute care settingBachelor’s degree. Completion of basic coding course (academic, seminar, workshop or facility-based), including medical terminology and basic anatomy and physiology, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.AHIMA or AAPC approved credential requiredPreferred Computer Applications: Microsoft Office applications, 3M Encoder, Cerner, EPIC, Meditech, and others as required

Job Description   Qualifications:•	Registered Nurse with active PRC License•	Certified Hemodialysis (HD) - Optional•	Nurse Certified Basic Life Support (BLS)•	Open to newly Licensed NursesClinical Functions:•	Facilitates admission of new patients and explain hemodialysis treatment procedure thoroughly. Performs intensive handling of treatment of patients.•	Makes thorough assessment of the patients and management of possible complications during the entire treatment.•	Ensures complete monitoring and recording of pre and post status of patients.•	Carries out doctors order.•	Obtains blood specimen of the patient for laboratory testing.•	Educates patient by promoting the understanding and care of their disease.•	Manages the encoding of data to the dialysis machine required in the conduct of the dialysis treatment. Takes responsibility for processing of blood return upon completing the dialysis treatment of the patient. Assists volunteers and trainees during the course of the dialysis training program.Technical Functions:•	Ensures compliance of dialysis staff in the proper handling of equipment in the center.•	Reports defects, breakdowns and problems of any equipment or supplies in the center to the head nurse. Assists the Dialysis Center Technician in the reprocessing and storage of the dialyzers.•	Ensures ISO documentation and monitoring in the absence of the Dialysis Center Technician.•	Assists in the preparations of HD machines prior to treatment:•	priming of bloodlines and dialyzer prepare basic supplies needed in the conduct of dialysis treatment on a daily basis especially in the absence Technician.•	Performs the residual testing prior to hooking.

Job Description: Job Description   JOB DETAILS:Interact with health plan members (Member Engagement) through outbound and inbound telephone contact to review and assess health plan member’s eligibility for Dual Enrollment Advocate (DEA).Conduct a real-time review of correspondences and/or inquiries from the health plan members to determine eligibility of the health plan member to qualify in State provided programs: Dual Enrollment Advocate (i.e. Medicare Savings Program), low income subsidy (LIS) and community advocate (CA).Conducts telephonic outreach to remind, assist, and keep the members enrolled by both phone outreach and mailings. Ensure that applications are filled out and every question is answered correctly before the member submits it to the state.Must conduct proper and effective follow up to ensure state renewal applications are sent to the state in a timely manner and documents are received to conduct further assistance.Place high value on qualities integrity, empathy, quality and trust. As a Change Healthcare Advocate, you will have every opportunity to improve the lives of others. When you join our team, you stand on the foundation of a successful organization that enriches individual lives. You become the voice of our organization to millions of individuals. Individuals who are looking for services and solutions to improve their quality of life.REQUIRED EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:Bachelor’s Degree, preferred; or at least 2 year college degree or level, requiredAt least 3 years of work experience in call center setting, preferredHealthcare experience preferred but not requiredProficient in MS Office ApplicationsCan speak MandarinWhat's in it for youCompetitive salary packageFull-time employmentJob stabilityWork-life balanceExciting benefits such as Retirement plan with investmentHMO, Life insuranceWFH until further notice

Job Description: Job Description   ABOUT OUR CLIENT: CHANGE HEALTHCARE PHILIPPINES, INC.:Change Healthcare Philippines is a captive center in the healthcare industry- they are a registered business entity here in the Philippines but their headquarters is in the US. They are a global healthcare company operating in over 120 locations in the world, one of which is the Philippines. They operate primarily in Picadilly Star in BGC with over 600 employees already but they will be expanding their workforce here, which will more than double their current headcount- that means opportunities for growth as they are pioneering new roles and creating better career development paths for talents in healthcare and BPO sectors. -Change Healthcare has various lines of businesses.The Philippine operations support their technology-enabled solutions such as software for medical imaging and major healthcare management processes such as financial management (medical claims), chart retrieval, clinical operations. -Change Healthcare started its operations in the Philippines in 2011 with Microsourcing providing services such as Payroll, Recruitment, IT and Facilities management- don't be confused about it! The recruitment process you're undergoing right now is facilitated by Microsourcing. Once successful, you'll be working for Change Healthcare Philippines directly, your contract will reflect that as well. The hiring managers do ask our applicants about their knowledge of Change Healthcare as a company, we encourage you to also explore more by visiting their website- www.changehealthcare.com.JOB SUMMARY:As the operations lead in the Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) team, you will be responsible for ensuring all operational tickets are being done in an efficient and timely manner. Responsibilities includes:Responsible for ensuring timely feedback is provided to our internal customers and prioritize operational tickets as needed.Help the team on SRE work like reliability, security and efficiency Enterprise Imaging Cloud SaaS solution.Perform production deployments, monitoring, ensuring SLAs are met, and incident response management.Improve operation process via software development by building automation for otherwise manual work.Minimum RequirementsBachelor's degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Engineering or related field or equivalent experience.3+ years of DevOps/SRE/Cloud Infrastructure experience or equivalent experience in mainstream software development1+ year in leadership or project lead type of responsibility such as managing a devops team or large operations project2+ years of experience in programming/scripting.Excellent communicator (both verbal and written). The role requires interaction with many teams.Willing to be on-call rotation (however there are plans to have teams in different timezones).Solid foundation in OS scripting & administration experience: Linux (bash, SSH etc) & Windows (Powershell).Additional Requirements (in order of preference)Good programming skills (e.g. Git, Python, Bash, Powershell)Strong knowledge of cloud infrastructure including compute, networking, storage and other cloud services e.g. (GCP, AWS, Azure)Strong knowledge of software fundamentals like web traffic (HTTP, TCP, REST), Networking, VPNs, Certs, LoadBalancers etcInfrastructure as code (e.g. Terraform, Ansible, Chef, Puppet)Experienced in containerization technologies (e.g. Docker, GKE/Kubernetes, EKS, Rancher)Setup and use of monitoring frameworks (e.g. Stackdriver, Influx db/TICK, grafana, ELK, prometheus, splunk, Nagios, NewRelic, Dynatrace etc)Analytical mindset with ability to troubleshoot, prioritize and solve complex problemsAble and willing to work in a fast paced, quickly changing environment.Preferred additional requirements:2+ years (or certification) in administration/automation of cloud infrastructure and deployed applications for enterprise SaaS or PaaS companies in public clouds such as AWS, GCP, Azure.2+ years and a proven record of success of using/creating automated delivery and configuration tools (CI/CD and monitoring tools).Independent work ethic and effective at negotiating with peers without direct authority.Experience with InfoSec and Compliance (e.g. HIPAA , PHI, Soc2).

Job Description: Job Description   TeleTech is on the search for a USRN Healthcare Professional to proactively create meaningful connections with our team.You became a nurse to support others. You have the empathy and the drive. And nursing can also be a challenging field. It is this passion for helping others that makes you the best at what you do. Why not consider a change of scenery. TeleTech is actively hiring US RNs (nurse with NCLEX certification) to support customers of pharmaceutical organizations who need you.Now, more than ever, how we connect is everything. Our purpose is to deliver humanity to business – and it's more relevant than ever before in today’s environment. We know we’re stronger together, working towards a purpose that matters. As TeleTech team members we lift each other up, deliver smiles, and support our communities. Join us in our commitment to deliver amazing experiences.What you’ll need to qualify:•	Active unrestricted USRN license•	2+ years clinical experience in a hospital, acute care, home health / hospice, direct care or case management preferred•	Exceptional English verbal and written communication skills•	Ability to thrive in a dynamic environment•	Previous customer service or Clinical Process Outsourcing experience is a plusWhat your typical day will consist of:•	Interact with pharmacy technicians, physicians, and colleagues from other departments•	Respond to internal inquiries with compassion and active listening and select the best solution in an efficient manner•	Gather clinical information, criteria information and work within regulatory guidelines•	Positively participate in company events, in team meetings, and support your peersWhat you'll enjoy:•	A competitive salary package plus a ₱150,000 Sign-On Bonus!•	Company-sponsored HMO with Health & Wellness programs for you and your family•	Educational assistance through tuition reimbursement•	And more.Accepting digital applications for your protection and the protection of our employees: Apply online or text ‘TTEC’ to +63 922 110 1170 to connect with us.TTEC is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. TTEC embraces and is committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce that respects and empowers the cultures and perspectives within our global teams. We strive to reflect the communities we serve by not only delivering amazing service and technology, but also humanity. We make it a point to make sure all our employees feel valued and comfortable being their authentic selves at work. As a global company, we know diversity is our strength. It enables us to view projects and ideas from different vantage points and allows every individual to bring value to the table in their own unique way. But don’t take our word for it — check out some our women in leadership and diversity awards on TTECjobs.com.For more information about TeleTech, click on About Us or search #ExperienceTeleTech throughout social media to engage in the global conversation.

Job Description: Job Description   Position Title: Procurement AssistantDuty station: Manila (Global) Administrative Centre (MAC)Job classification: General Staff/ G-5Type of Appointment: Fixed term, one year with possibility of extensionClosing date: 09 Jun 2021Salary: Php 603,027 per annum net of taxesContextUnder the overall supervision of the Head of the GPSU and the direct supervision of the Team Leader, Medical Procurement Team, GPSU and in coordination with the USRAP Medical Advisor, Procurement Assistant will provide support to Missions worldwide including the Manila Administrative Centre (MAC) by providing assistance in the procurement of medical supplies and equipment for Medical Health Department(MHD) Operations worldwide.Core Functions / ResponsibilitiesThe Procurement Assistant will be responsible for carrying out the following:1.) Plan procurement actions for assigned projects, some of which are highly complex:a) Review, record and prioritize purchasing requests, obtain additional information and or documentation as required, provide assistance to requisitioners in preparing scope of work and specifications of goods and services;b) Prepare and finalize Source Selection Plan for complex purchases;c) Post tender requirement in the IOM and UNGM websites for formal solicitations;d) Produce tender documents (e.g. Invitation to bids, Request for Proposals and Request for Quotations) based on the nature of the requirements and cost of procurement involved.2.) Compile and present procurement data for presentations and/or report monitoring:a) Follow up with sections to expedite the process of technical evaluation;b) Submit upon initial screening technical proposals to the requisitioner or the BEAC for technical evaluation;c) Prepare and analyse abstracts of offers and compile data contained in quotations, proposals and bids to determine which vendor could deliver the required goods/services at the best terms and lowest costs possible;d) Prepare presentations for review and clearance by the GPSU Head and present to GPSU Compliance Review in respect of all proposed contract awards exceeding the GPSU’s authority, and obtain recommendation for approval from the MAC Director.3.) Draft and issue Contracts; and post-award financial managementa) Draft Purchase Orders, Supply and Service Contracts, Lease Agreements, Amendment to the Contracts and POs, Prepare Statement of Awards, Ensure that Contracts/PO are timely renewed;b) Resolve issues/problems related to delivered goods / rendered services, including discrepancies between contracts/purchase orders and articles received; prepare, sign and return to vendor forms for unacceptable services and/or goods received;c) Monitor POs and contracts including follow up actions and follow up for timely delivery of goods and services. Raise Change Order if required;d) Liaise permanently with the rest of the Procurement Units in order to ensure that contracts/ purchase orders are timely renewed; and follow up with requisitioner for completeness and submission of vendor performance report after completion of the order / contract and take appropriate action;e) Maintain relevant internal database and files, keeps track of any contractual agreements and informs respective contract management officials and end users of contractual rights and obligations, monitor deadlines (e.g. delivery dates, expiry dates, renewal dates, etc.) taking appropriate and timely action to ensure timely delivery.4.) Identify new vendors for registration and inclusion in the roster for an enhanced competitiveness and benefit from opportunities for long-term agreements.5.) Serve as point of contact and liaison with UN staff and other stakeholders for procurement, ERP related issues and other logistical matters. Effectively use the Organization’s ERP system to generate procurement related reports and suitable data required for procurement reporting.6.) Support GPSU in creating, maintaining and enforcing medical procurement guidelines in cooperation with the Migration Health Division HQ, CDC and other donors to standardize, streamline and facilitate procurement of medical supplies and equipment for MHD Operations worldwide.OTHER TASKS7.) Coordinate with the Migration Health Division on procurement matters.8.) Prepare procurement monitoring reports and documents as required.9.) Prepare Request for Payment for submission to Accounts Payable Unit for processing of payment to vendors.10.) Provide guidance on medical procurement issues as needed.11.) Perform other related duties as required.Required Qualifications and ExperienceEducationUniversity degree in Pharmacy, Healthcare or any related Supply Chain or Business Administration Management or a related field from an accredited academic institution, with three years of relevant professional experience; orCompleted high school degree from an accredited academic institution, with five years of relevant professional experience.Specialized trainings on procurement and logistics would be an advantage.ExperienceProgressively responsible professional experience in procurement, administrative services or related area is required.Professional experience in procurement, contract management, or a related area, within the UN common system or in an international public organization, is desirable.Experience working with an ERP system in the area of purchasing and/or supply chain is desirable.A professional certification by an internationally recognized procurement certification authority such as CIPS (level 2 certificate or equivalent) is desirable.Proficiency in SAP, MS Office applications such as Word and Excel; knowledge of other applications such as, PowerPoint and Visio will be helpful.Excellent organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously under time constraints, accurate and detail oriented.Team player; ability to work effectively with different levels within and outside the organization and with colleagues from varied cultures and professional backgrounds.How to ApplyInterested candidates are invited to submit their applications via IOM Philippines jobsite not later than 09 June 2021 with reference code VN 034/2021 Procurement Assistant.For further information, please refer to: https://philippines.iom.int/jobs/vacancies/vn-0342021-vn-0342021-procurement-assistant-g-5-manila-global-administrative-centre-macIOM welcomes applicants from qualified individuals, irrespective of their race, religion, skin, color, nationality, age, disability status, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, family structure, mental health status, or any other characteristic.Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Job Title: Philippine Registered Nurse with Free Hemodialysis Training
Job Description: Job Description   Clinical Functions:•	Facilitates admission of new patients and explain hemodialysis treatment procedure thoroughly. Performs intensive handling of treatment of patients.•	Makes thorough assessment of the patients and management of possible complications during the entire treatment.•	Ensures complete monitoring and recording of pre and post status of patients.•	Carries out doctors order.•	Obtains blood specimen of the patient for laboratory testing.•	Educates patient by promoting the understanding and care of their disease.•	Manages the encoding of data to the dialysis machine required in the conduct of the dialysis treatment. Takes responsibility for processing of blood return upon completing the dialysis treatment of the patient. Assists volunteers and trainees during the course of the dialysis training program.Technical Functions:•	Ensures compliance of dialysis staff in the proper handling of equipment in the center.•	Reports defects, breakdowns and problems of any equipment or supplies in the center to the head nurse. Assists the Dialysis Center Technician in the reprocessing and storage of the dialyzers.•	Ensures ISO documentation and monitoring in the absence of the Dialysis Center Technician.•	Assists in the preparations of HD machines prior to treatment:•	priming of bloodlines and dialyzer prepare basic supplies needed in the conduct of dialysis treatment on a daily basis especially in the absence Technician.•	Performs the residual testing prior to hooking.Qualifications:•	Registered Nurse with active PRC License•	Certified Hemodialysis (HD)•	Nurse Certified Basic Life Support (BLS)•	Open to newly Licensed Nurses

Job Description   Software engineering is the application of engineering to the design, development, implementation, testing and maintenance of software in a systematic method. The roles in this function will cover all primary development activity across all technology functions that ensure we deliver code with high quality for our applications, products and services and to understand customer needs and to develop product roadmaps. These roles include, but are not limited to analysis, design, coding, engineering, testing, debugging, standards, methods, tools analysis, documentation, research and development, maintenance, new development, operations and delivery. With every role in the company, each position has a requirement for building quality into every output. This also includes evaluating new tools, new techniques, strategies; Automation of common tasks; build of common utilities to drive organizational efficiency with a passion around technology and solutions and influence of thought and leadership on future capabilities and opportunities to apply technology in new and innovative ways. Positions will vary in impact to IOI tied to DTC, Call Center Optimization, Lead Generation, and Digital Transformation.Primary Responsibilities: •	Implement solutions that exemplify modern practices•	Reuse and / or develop moderately advanced instrumentation and diagnostics•	Reuse and develop self-documenting functions, API's and micro-services to solve moderately advanced problems•	Implement modern components, tools and technologies•	Implement practices that support ATDD and CI/CD•	Implement solutions to address issues and ensure efficient and consistent solutions•	Reuse and develop algorithms to solve moderately advanced problems•	Reuse and develop data structures to solve moderately advanced problems•	Understand all the connected technology services and their impacts•	Assess ideas in context of maximizing business value•	Assess design and proposes options to ensure solution meets business needs in terms of security, scalability, reliability and feasibility•	Collaborate with relevant stakeholders to achieve business outcomes•	Design and build services to allow them to be automated•	Identify opportunities to use AI / ML technologies•	Responsibility across ALL brands for one to many of the following: website performance, consumer experience, UI / UX, services, etc.•	Partner with developers to design and deliver clean, efficient code based on business and innovation specifications•	Integrate software components and third-party programs, verify and deploy programs / systems, troubleshoot, debug and upgrade software both custom and leased•	Analyze and investigate•	Provide explanations and interpretations within area of expertise•	Interpret policies and apply experience•	Comply with the terms and conditions of the employment contract, company policies and procedures, and any and all directives (such as, but not limited to, transfer and/or re-assignment to different work locations, change in teams and/or work shifts, policies in regards to flexibility of work benefits and/or work environment, alternative work arrangements, and other decisions that may arise due to the changing business environment). The Company may adopt, vary or rescind these policies and directives in its absolute discretion and without any limitation (implied or otherwise) on its ability to do soRequired Qualifications: •	5+ years of relevant experience in C#.NET, ReactJS, Typescript, NodeJS, MaterialUI•	5+ years of relevant or related experience in MS SQL 2005 and higher•	Experience with mastering a variety of programming languages and practice building software•	Knowledgeable in software development and testing concepts and methodology•	Object-Oriented Programming Design and UML methodologies with analytical skills•	Strong communication skills

S/he is expected to take the main responsibility of performing Quality Assurance can be Manual or Automated tests or both.S/he must support project delivery by working with the project team to coordinate user acceptance testing on the company’s developed products and services, ensuring all user-reported bugs are valid and properly endorsed to and resolved by the development team within the UAT period, including retesting of bug fixes.Consolidate business requirements together with the country-specific Product Owner in EuropeCoordinate business requirements within and outside the teamDocument testing standards and strategies in our project portalParticipate in the creation of User StoriesCreate Test PlanCreate Test Cases to be used during the testing activitiesCoordinate testing activities within and outside the teamParticipate in other testing activities aside from the current projectCoordinate releasesCoordinate Production support issuesParticipate in Production Testing focusing on SecurityParticipate in the Usability Testing for UX DesignersParticipate in the creation of WireframesParticipate in Sprint Planning, Daily Scrum Meeting, Sprint Review, and Sprint RetrospectiveMust have:Test Automation with more than (10) years of experienceInterested applicants may send their resume to [Confidential Information]

Category: Industry:     Hospitals / Healthcare / Diagnostics ,   IT / Computers - Software
Job Description: Job Description   As an integral member of our delivery team, the Business Intelligence (BI) Report Specialist is responsible for the design, development, implementation and support of mission-critical enterprise Business Intelligence (BI) reports. Working with cross-functional teams, you will participate to gather and document reporting requirements to meet business needs. Using your skills and experience as a BI Report Specialist, you will then use those requirements to design, develop, test and implement reports and dashboards that utilize the underlying data store(s)/ data warehouse(s) / data mart(s). The BI Report Specialist interacts with the BI Team lead, Functional Key Users, Global Master Data Managers, Web Developer, Database Programmers, the Support Team and external providers like consultantsResponsibilities:Participate in business analysis activities to gather required reporting and dashboard requirements. Translate business requirements into specifications that will be used to implement the required reports and dashboards, created from potentially multiple data sources.Participate with other specialist to convert legacy reports (like Tableau, Qlik, OBIEE etc.) to Microsoft PowerBI solutions.Transition developed reports and dashboards to the Operations & Support team.Provide support as required to ensure the availability and performance of developed reports and dashboards for both external and internal usersEnsure proper configuration management and change controls are implemented for your sphere of influence.Provide technical assistance and cross training to other team membersProvide training and assistance to users for generation of adhoc reports.Design and implement technology best practices, guidelines and repeatable processesQualifications:Graduate of BA/BS in Computer Science or related field is preferable. Equivalent combination of experience, education and training will be consideredAt least (3) years relevant experience Very strong knowledge and experience with MS Power BI. Proficiency with Microsoft on-prem and cloud BI stack (MSSQL, Azure SQL etc.)Experience developing and implementing enterprise-scale reports and dashboards, including: Working with users in a requirements analysis role- Extensive experience with data warehouse implementations- Knowledge of logical and physical data modeling concepts (relational and dimensional)Performance tuning experience related to reporting queries requiredUnderstanding of data integration issues (validation and cleaning), familiarity with complex data and structuresRequires strong analytical, conceptual and problem-solving abilities: Programming / scripting experience and knowledge of software development life cycle is preferredAbility to manage multiple priorities, and assess and adjust quickly to changing prioritiesInterested applicants may send their resume to [Confidential Information]

Category: Industry:     Hospitals / Healthcare / Diagnostics ,   IT / Computers - Software
Job Description: Job Description   We are seeking talented Senior RPA developers to drive our digital transformation journey and engage with internal and external clients to uncover, define and solve complex challenges. In return, we can offer a rewarding career that makes a difference, with plenty of opportunities for learning and self-development.ResponsibilitiesDevelop RPA process solutions in accordance w/ standard RPA conventions (including guidelines for maximizing reuse of solutions)Execute automation solution development (process and technical architecture)Produce & maintain respective documents (e.g. Solution Design Document) Provide support for solution testing to ensure alignment with the actual process, resolve performance problems discovered in testingOperate the robotic tooling to interact with the base applicationsCode required logic for processing and exception scenariosSupport go-live roll outProvide immediate post-project support for the configured robotsRequirements:4 to 6 years of IT development experience with at least 2 years in Blue Prism. Background in Development and or testing along with some architecture/designing partStrong knowledge of business context and processesExperience designing, developing, testing and deploying Robotics solutionsSkilled in various development platforms knowledge of NLP, Python, C# , Visual studio , VB , SQL , MYSQL is an advantage Good communication skills with the ability to present technical details to a non-technical audienceThe ability to work with a structured and methodical approach, combined with an enquiring mind.An understanding of, and a willingness to adhere to, formal change control procedures and disciplinesAn aptitude for problem solving, with the ability to take a logical route to the source of an error.Participate in Product releases through release document review, deployment etc.Should be able to execute assigned tasks in a timely & efficient manner.Effectively communicate status, metrics and issues on a regular basisYou will be working closely with the automation Team in the MD headquarters in Copenhagen, Denmark so excellent communication skills are necessary You are fluent in both oral and written EnglishITIL V3 Certified is a plusAble to work in Midshift schedule (EMEA)Willing to work in Makati City (if needed)Interested applicants may send their resume to [Confidential Information]

Job Description: Job Description   Knowledge and Experience1.	Must have Ultrasound and 2D Echo experience2.	Related work experience, operating Ultrasound and 2D Echo equipment in a clinical (hospital, lab, clinic) setting.3.	MS Office software including Word, Outlook, Excel and PowerPoint.4.	Commercial applications experience a plus.Willing to work in Pasig/QC area.Qualifications1.	Strong interpersonal, organizational and communication skills.2.	Strong customer interface and training skills.3.	Ability to work independently.4.	Ability to follow directions.5.	Ability to travel 70% or more of the time.6.	Self-motivated with the ability to work under minimal supervision in an environment that requires strong teamwork and cross-functional interaction.7.	Effectively and appropriately displays professional skills necessary to manage interpersonal relationships with team members, colleagues and customers – knows and follows appropriate lines of escalation; knows when and to whom issues should be raised; knows which issues should be addressed publicly and which issues should be addressed in private; etc.8.	Effectively manages daily tasks.9.	Works in a well-organized manner, consistently meeting customer and time requirements.10.	Strives for constant improvement; inspires and motivates others.Responsibilities1.	Provide product demonstration support in hospitals, clinics, private offices, and other medical facilities.2.	Deliver post-sales installation training and customer retention activities.3.	Assist with product training for Ultrasounds and 2D Echo to field Sales Representatives.4.	Supports tradeshow and other marketing activities.5.	Complete required administrative activities.6.	Provide customer feedback to Marketing.

Coaches pharmacy assistants and monitors consistency the implementation of customer service and selling standards to sustain customer loyalty8. Evaluate and correctly interpret prescriptions and liaise with Doctors if needed9. Promo execution10.Checks accuracy of prices and stocks11.Competency Building and Assessment

Job Description   What will you do Responsible for managing Long Duration claims to resolution in a proactive manner. This includes determining if insured employees continue to be eligible for disability benefits through to implementing the right interventions to support recovery and return to work. Assess claims for continued benefit entitlement by reviewing contractual, medical, functional and occupational information - Sources include, but are not limited to, Independent Medical Evaluations, Functional Capacity Evaluations, medical consultant opinions, Rehabilitation Consultant resources, and consulting Mental Health Experts. Assess claims for return-to-work potential and apply strategies based on a variety of interventions including but not limited to: rehabilitation, vocational programs and non-litigated settlements. Identify and assess medical and non-medical influencing factors. Work collaboratively with insured employees, clients, lawyers, health care practitioners and other stakeholders to obtain information, provide claim status, create action plans and provide verbal and written decisions while maintaining confidentiality and privacy. Prepare call strategies in advance, including possible interventions and/or claim resolution strategies. Conduct motivational interviewing within the context of leading exploratory conversations with plan members who have been on claim for prolonged periods of time. Build strong relationships with our clients; employers and their employees. Build relationships with third party providers to develop and implement creative solutions to help plan members develop new skillsets and re-train for new occupations, return to work part- time and/or at commensurate level. Conduct research and keep abreast of new practices and developments in treatment options in the medical field. What do you need to succeed University degree completed or related experienceMinimum of 3 years experience in disability management Experience in rehabilitation would be a strong asset, specifically related to researching, developing and successfully executing on a variety of interventions including return-to-work programs, and short-term/long-term vocational rehabilitation. Strong communication skills - ability to problem-solve on the spot, considering multiple strategies including the cost/benefit analysis of each strategy. Includes identifying barriers and creative approaches in order to achieve business outcomes. Effective interpersonal skills including negotiation and facilitation where conflicting needs exist. Includes demonstrating empathy, with outstanding listening skills. Ability to prioritize work items in order to meet client service standards and Sun Life best practice guidelines Thrives in a dynamic, fast paced environment while maintaining attention to detail with complex claims and contracts Adaptability, flexibility, and excellent organization skills Ability to make sound decisions, supported by strong rationale Excellent written and verbal communication skills Typing skills and ability to be a strong functional user of various computer based programs. Strong computer literacy in Word, Outlook, Excel, Internet Collaborative Team Player

Category: Industry:     Banking / Accounting / Financial Services ,   ITES / BPO
Job Description: Job Description   The Finance Analyst role will support the Account Management and Ops Finance leadership teams in streamlining data and delivering meaningful operational insights. This member of the team will be instilling a technical focus on linking systems and process to best facilitate results. The incumbent will use technical capability, business acumen, and financial knowledge to drive improved reporting and analysis that can be leveraged across the entire Corporate and Shared Services FP&A organization.Responsibilities will include:Support the design and implementation of a cohesive data strategy geared toward the creation of a world-class FP&A organization.Construct rules, process, and reporting to support effective management and analysis of Account Management KPIs across disparate systems. KPIs include but are not limited to renewals, revenue, rate compression, client attrition, credits, expense.Develop and liaison with key business partners to create dashboards to manage information delivery and critical metrics.Create and deliver critical monthly financial reporting and analysis to key business partners. Provide actionable insights based on data.Identify performance improvement and operational excellence opportunities. Drive process improvement using Lean Six Sigma and related operational excellence systems/tools.Work collaboratively with various business units/departments across Change Healthcare and deliver ad hoc analytical projects.Provide support for essential business improvement and corporate strategy projects.Minimum Qualifications:Education: BA/BS Degree in Business or closely related fieldMinimum of 2 years’ experience in an analytic role, developing metrics, presenting insights, and managing large disparate data setsCritical Skills:Self-starter and independent strategic thinker.Advanced level knowledge and capability in database prep and dashboard tools such as: SQL, Access, Excel, Spotfire, Power BI, Tableau, Incorta or other related tools for the analysis and presentation of KPI’s.Proven experience in creating KPI’s and communicating meaningful insights to various levels of an organization.Expertise supporting commercial sales operations, contract operations, and/or financial planning & analysis.What's in it for youCompetitive salary packageFull-time employmentJob stabilityWork-life balanceExciting benefits such as Retirement plan with investmentHMO, Life insuranceWFH until further notice

Job Title: US Registered Nurses - 150K Sign on Bonus- Work From Home - Cainta Site
Location: Permanent Job,                           Work From Home,                           Jobs for COVID-19 Layoffs
Job Description: Job Description   TeleTech is on the search for a Work from Home USRN Healthcare Professional to proactively create meaningful connections with our team. You became a nurse to support others. You have the empathy and the drive. And nursing can also be a challenging field. It is this passion for helping others that makes you the best at what you do. Why not consider a change of scenery. TeleTech is actively hiring US RNs (nurse with NCLEX certification) to support customers of pharmaceutical organizations who need you. Now, more than ever, how we connect is everything. Our purpose is to deliver humanity to business – and it's more relevant than ever before in today’s environment. We know we’re stronger together, working towards a purpose that matters. As TeleTech team members we lift each other up, deliver smiles, and support our communities. Join us in our commitment to deliver amazing experiences. What you’ll need to qualify:•	Active unrestricted USRN license•	2+ years clinical experience in a hospital, acute care, home health / hospice, direct care or case management preferred•	Exceptional English verbal and written communication skills•	Ability to thrive in a dynamic environment•	Previous customer service or Clinical Process Outsourcing experience is a plus Technology and work environment requirements - Work from Home: •	Have the right connection – a home internet connection that is >15Mbps (you may do a quick check through Fast.com)•	Computer – we’ll supply and deliver at your doorstep•	Must be able to hard-wire (via ethernet cord) directly into your home modem•	Must have a quiet workspace that is within a reasonable proximity of your router so that you can plug in while working What your typical day will consist of:•	Handles secondary review of medications that are not approvable on technician level.•	Review documentation and interprets data obtained from clinical records such as patient laboratory results, diagnostic tests, office visit notes and medical history.•	Applies appropriate clinical criteria and policies in line with regulatory and accreditation requirements for the medication being requested.•	Coordinates the case to internal Pharmacists for further assessment if there's inadequate information to decision the case. What you'll enjoy:•	A competitive salary package plus a ₱150,000 Sign-On Bonus!•	Company-sponsored HMO with Health & Wellness programs for you and your family•	Educational assistance through tuition reimbursement•	And more.Accepting digital applications for your protection and the protection of our employees: Apply online or text ‘TTEC’ to +63 922 110 1170 to connect with us.TTEC is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. TeleTech is actively hiring US RNs (nurse with NCLEX certification) to support customers of pharmaceutical organizations who need you.Now, more than ever, how we connect is everything. Our purpose is to deliver humanity to business – and it's more relevant than ever before in today’s environment. We know we’re stronger together, working towards a purpose that matters. As TeleTech team members we lift each other up, deliver smiles, and support our communities. Join us in our commitment to deliver amazing experiences.What you’ll need to qualify:•	Active unrestricted USRN license•	2+ years clinical experience in a hospital, acute care, home health / hospice, direct care or case management preferred•	Exceptional English verbal and written communication skills•	Ability to thrive in a dynamic environment•	Previous customer service or Clinical Process Outsourcing experience is a plusTechnology and work environment requirements - Work from Home: •	Have the right connection – a home internet connection that is >15Mbps (you may do a quick check through Fast.com)•	Computer – we’ll supply and deliver at your doorstep•	Must be able to hard-wire (via ethernet cord) directly into your home modem•	Must have a quiet workspace that is within a reasonable proximity of your router so that you can plug in while workingWhat your typical day will consist of:•	Handles secondary review of medications that are not approvable on technician level.•	Review documentation and interprets data obtained from clinical records such as patient laboratory results, diagnostic tests, office visit notes and medical history.•	Applies appropriate clinical criteria and policies in line with regulatory and accreditation requirements for the medication being requested.•	Coordinates the case to internal Pharmacists for further assessment if there's inadequate information to decision the case.What you'll enjoy:•	A competitive salary package plus a ₱150,000 Sign-On Bonus!•	Company-sponsored HMO with Health & Wellness programs for you and your family•	Educational assistance through tuition reimbursement•	And more.Accepting digital applications for your protection and the protection of our employees: Apply online or text ‘TTEC’ to +63 922 110 1170 to connect with us.TTEC is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Job Description   This individual is responsible for Corporate Shared Services will drive the initial planning and ongoing forecast over several corporate functions. This individual will lead efforts to coordinate with internal accounting teams and corporate function leadership to develop thoughtful plans and forecasts. They will be responsible for the review of actual activity, communication of results to stakeholders and identification of risks and opportunities in the forecast.Job Responsibilities:Work with Corporate leadership to develop FY22 forecastsComplete variance analyses for month to date and year to date financial results against planCommunicate variances to stakeholders (Corporate Leadership and other BU FP&A teams)Continue to enhance effectiveness by building simple and effective analytical tools which enable better trend analysis and forecasting capabilitiesDevelop and monitor shared service allocations (allocating corporate costs to business units)Support the development of automated reporting, dashboards, and visualization tools to improve speed and accuracy of insightsVarious other standard and ad hoc projects and initiatives, as requiredMinimum Requirements:A Bachelor’s degree required with preference toward a degree in accounting, finance, economics, or related quantitative discipline. CPA/MBA preferred.4-5 years of professional experience in a corporate finance or related function with a demonstrated record of successMust have extremely strong MS Excel skills and experience with financial consolidation, reporting, and forecasting toolsWhat's in it for youCompetitive salary packageFull-time employmentJob stabilityWork-life balanceExciting benefits such as Retirement plan with investmentHMO, Life insuranceWFH until further notice

Category: Industry:     IT / Computers - Hardware & Networking ,   IT / Computers - Software
Job Description: Job Description   This position is responsible for providing remote systems support and maintenance for mission-critical Radiology imaging and workflow systems that are deployed at customer facilities around the world.The individual is engaged in utilizing their specialized knowledge of the Enterprise Imaging suite of products as well as applying professional judgment to assist with the investigation and analysis of the system to address customer issues and to help in problem solving and resolution to root cause.Responsibilities:Troubleshoot issues on production RIS and PACS radiology systems which utilize some of the following technologies: proprietary Change Healthcare software, Local & Wide Area Networks, Windows Servers and workstations, Enterprise-class hardware & storage systems, and Oracle databasesLiaison with internal teams within Support as required to deliver on customer requestsContribute to a fast-paced and highly collaborative team based work environmentPerform scheduled preventative maintenance and systems administration functions at customer facilitiesIdentify opportunities for further team education and growth.Seek and suggest competence and career development opportunities to current managementAbility to develop in-depth product knowledge and a commitment to continuous learning and personal development.Requirements:Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science/Engineering or Computer Technology Diploma and equivalent experience or equivalent related experience and certification (MCSE, A+, etc.)2 - 3 years of experience as a Level 2 SupportExperience diagnosing and troubleshooting software and/or on computer systems. Experience in a software technical support or customer service environment.Must be skilled in Server Administration, Network Maintenance & Troubleshooting, VirtualizationMust know how to conduct root cause analysis and can troubleshoot complex technical issues2 - 3 years of exposure in doing remote/ offshore supportGood English communication skills - ability to expound the situation and resolution in certain challenges encounteredWhat's in it for youCompetitive salary packageFull-time employmentJob stabilityWork-life balanceExciting benefits such as Retirement plan with investmentHMO, Life insuranceWFH until further notice

Job Description   The Information Security Contract Analyst ensures that Change Healthcare’s customer and vendor agreements protect Change Healthcare, employees, customers, and the security of sensitive data under our care. This person interacts primarily with internal team members (e.g., attorneys, legal specialists, procurement staff, information security staff, information technology (IT) staff, account management, sales staff, product subject matter experts, senior management) and with external parties (e.g., customers and vendors).Principal Responsibilities•	Reviewing the security requirements within customer and vendor contracts, and negotiating terms within approved limits.•	Maintaining play books to be utilized by all internal parties (e.g., legal, procurement) involved with the security requirements of customer and vendor contracts•	Project managing and driving the resolution of unresolved terms•	Assessing and presenting risks associated with contract terms to the appropriate stakeholders.•	Collaborating and providing guidance on how risks should be addressed.•	Facilitating and executing, as needed, the development and maintenance of policies, standards, procedures, and security-related templates based upon changing business, regulatory, and customer requirements and technologies•	Maintaining and presenting appropriate metrics that would support decisions around resources, roadmaps, finance, and strategy•	Maintaining, supporting, and escalating, as needed, the tracking data of one-off or unique customer/vendor commitments•	Driving and supporting the continuous maturity of our policies, standards, procedures, and tools for relevant areas of the companyQUALIFICATIONS/COMPETENCIES/SKILLS:Detail-oriented work habits and strong typing and computer skills, including fluency with word processing, spreadsheet, database, Sharepoint and Powerpoint programsKnowledge of and/or experience with United States healthcare security laws and regulations, especially the Health Information Portability and Accountability Act of 1996 (HIPAA) or with well-known security control frameworks, e.g. the Health Information Trust Alliance (HITRUST) Common Security Framework (CSF), the Payment Card Industry (PCI) Data Security Standard (DSS), National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) Cybersecurity-related publications and frameworks, International Standards Organization (ISO) 27001/27002.Bachelor’s degree, Paralegal or Juris Doctor (JD) a plus2-5 years corporate legal experience in a law firm or in-house legal department (IT Services, Application, Hosting, or healthcare company preferred)2-5 years’ experience in IT Risk Management, e.g. IT Auditor or Assessor.Experience reviewing and negotiating contractsPREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:Technology-related degree or certifications, or at least five years technology experience preferredCertified Information Systems Security Professional (CISP), Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA), or Certified Information Security Manager (CISM) Certification preferred

Job Description: Job Description   The Social Media & Service Excellence Specialist is responsible for day-to-day reputation recovery for online rating sites and social media channels across all social platforms that Tenet and its affiliates engage on. The Specialist will work directly with the Social Media & Service Excellence Supervisor to execute the online reputation recovery and social media plan for Tenet’s hospital handles including free standing EDs and select ambulatory centers. This role is intended to report to the Social Media & Service Excellence Supervisor and support the Patient Experience by responding in real time to consumer complaints posted online. This role will help eliminate the burden of monitoring and responding to online reviews from the Regions and Hospitals. The Specialist will be responsible for quickly responding to review comments including responding to reviews, escalating as appropriate and working with hospital teams to resolve issues, creating and organizing content, reviewing content provided by Tenet affiliates to ensure accuracy and ensuring content is posted to the appropriate social media channel in a timely manner in accordance with policy.Responsibilities and DutiesSpecific challenges include:Proficiency in social media including (but not limited to) Facebook, Yelp, Instagram, Pinterest and Linked-in.Ability to monitor and respond to social media users.Ability to properly escalate negative reviews and focus on service recovery. Ability to write and create posts that engage users and promote hospital services.Stays up to date with the latest social media functionsServes as a resource and trouble shooter for independent review sitesFocuses heavily on attention to detail and proofreads materials for accuracyGather facts and research for presentations on ROI and other results Analyze and understand successes and failures of strategy.Performing other related duties as required.

Job Description   This role is responsible for assessing and interpreting customer information security inquiries/requirements and how CHC complies with such requirements. While we do have an Enterprise Policy all business units must follow, not all business units are at the same maturity in applying the standards to comply. Therefore, this role must determine how best to respond to the demands of our customers with the intent to build their trust and support new or ongoing business with customers.Processes are defined, but much of what this role does is more art than science requiring the individual to assess the given scenario and make appropriate decisions to move things forward in a positive way. The individual needs to solve the problems presented by any given scenario.This role is accountable as the Information Security subject matter expert that will:Facilitate and execute responses to information security related customer requests: Customer Questionnaires, Audits, Remediation Plans, Test results, Contracts, Certifications, Attestations etc...Support redlining and negotiating customer security contractsSupport metricsAdminister, maintain and support the Customer Assurance Program, tools, processes, metrics, repositories, documentation, and artifacts Maintain a high-level understanding of all information security policy and functions at Change Healthcare to enable conversational discussions on our overall control posture Maintain an understanding of organizational structure, product portfolio and control ownership to enable response assignments and deliverablesEnsure remediation plans are tracked and executed as agreedSolicit and acquire responses from control owners that may not have responses readily availableOrganize on-site audits based on control areas and control owners to ensure efficient use of control owner and auditor timeCategorize control deficiencies by domain to develop risk reports and drive remediation of repeat control deficienciesEstablish strong working relationships with IT teams, internal business customers, external customers, and peers Manage open issues until resolutionThis role requires the InfoSec analyst to evolve the Customer Security Assurance program. Whether that evolution reduces costs, increases quality, or improved efficiencies. In performing their function, the InfoSec Analyst will many times need to think out of the box to solve problems they come across.Additional responsibilities:The resource will also administer, support and drive the evolution of tools and processes supporting the customer security assurance programAssist in the development of standard control response language and deliverables to ensure consistent and timely response to control inquiriesPartner with internal IT teams to develop remediation plans to address findingIdentify and execute process improvementsPartner with IT, security control owners and account managers to maintain positive customer satisfactionIdentify alternative methods for achieving compliance to required controlsQualifications:Prefer 4- Year college degree and/or equivalent experience in Healthcare and/or Sales Operations.IT Security, compliance or auditing certification preferred (e.g. such as CISSP, CISA, CISM or equivalent)3-5 years of experience in a risk management, security assessment, or internal audit capacity.IT Security, compliance or auditing certification preferred (e.g. such as CISSP, CISA, CISM or equivalent)(Preferred only)

Job Description: Job Description   This position ensures that all system components are maintained, updated, monitored, accessible, and available according to Cybersecurity standards, while partnering with other engineers in the evaluation, testing, and implementation of diverse solutions. Other key responsibilities include: Serve as subject matter expert for cybersecurity operations team and primary escalation point for SIEM platform issues, contribute to root-cause analysis, troubleshooting, and service restoration procedures. Contribute to the development of enterprise-wide cyber security strategy by contributing to efforts with other stakeholders and working directly with Tenet service providers. Reporting security gaps to leadership as applicable with appropriate recommendations Providing strategic direction for Tenet Corporate, Tenet Healthcare Facilities, and Tenet related business lines regarding data security, incident response, emerging cyber security technologies and industry best practices Design SIEM systems to meet growth while maintaining balance between performance, stability, and agility. Interface with cybersecurity engineers, governance, and IT teams to assist in obtaining data analytics or data protection reports and correlations. Develop effective correlation rules and perform ongoing development for additional use cases Tune SIEM components to ensure maximum reliability and reduce false positives Integrate SIEM with a wide variety of legacy data sources and industry leading commercial security tools. Assist and perform testing of implemented solutions, recommend improvements, and support the deployment of changes following Tenet's change and release management process. Perform maintenance and optimization of existing SIEM deployments Promptly respond to requests for assistance from SIEM users and others Adhere to relevant policies, procedures, standards and security good/accepted practices Resolve problems independently and understand escalation procedure Respond in a timely manner to all requests for access or other security exceptions requiring approval or involvement from the information security team Represent Tenet on external & internal risk and information security groups, as necessary. Create formal documentation such as reports, training material, slide decks, and architecture diagrams.WORK EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATION 5+ years Cybersecurity experience specializing in SIEM design and implementation BS in Computer Science or equivalent field preferred. Related job experience may be substituted.

leadership)Educate others and provide recommendations on the use and interpretation of performance metrics and data (e.g., AHT, ASA, service levels, performance guarantees, abandon rates, call defect rates, adherence, occupancy)Perform staffing analysis based on forecasted call volumes and resource needs to drive future business planningPerform strategic planning to identify future Workforce Management needs (e.g., site growth, new client/membership assignment)Collaborate with other groups to identify future staffing needs (e.g., Training, Human Capital, Operations, Forecasting)Collaborate with applicable stakeholders to ensure that financial goals are achieved (e.g., Finance, vendor sites)Gain an understanding of the technical and business solutions: optimized schedules, forecasts and other tools and present them to managementPrepare and maintain reports and dashboardsGain familiarity with analysis and ensure consistent methodologies are followed to maintain qualitySupport the preparation of ad hoc analysis that enables strong understanding of the businessProvide training on report, dashboard and package development to team members and management as neededRequirements: 7+ years of workforce management experience (i.e. responsible for scheduling, call volume monitoring, and adjusting. Capacity planning and  determining and communicating work schedules and resources for call queues, consulting with call operations, etc)3+ years of experience working in a service operations center3+ years of managerial experience3-5+ years of experience with workforce systems such as Avaya, CMS, IEX, eWFM, Genesis, and/or Blue PumpkinExperience with Call Center ACD experienceAdvance proficiency with MS Word and ExcelAssets:Project Management experienceExperience with Phone Switch tools (Avaya or IVR)Knowledge of IEX TotalView Knowledge of Human Resource policies and proceduresLocation: Can be assigned to any sitesShift: Night Shift

Job Description   At Cognizant, we’re not just helping our clients to embrace technology. We modernize their businesses in ways that empower them to thrive. Through cutting-edge models and tools, we build engaging digital experiences focused on progress – ensuring they stay relevant and accelerating their growth. For many, it means significant change. But our experts are always there to guide them. Roles and Responsibilities•	End to end process automation using UI PATH•	Automated almost all kinds of applications like Web based Application, PDF Documents, Thin Client Application, SAP, ORACLE, Database, Mainframe using RPA tool Ui path.•	Develop workflows and custom activities using Vb .Net/C#•	Evaluating the scope and feasibility of automation and ensure alignment with development teams and testing team and Ensuring timely deliveries.•	Extensively involved in Ui Path Designing, Coding and maintaining the RPA Robots•	Interacted with Client for requirement gathering and prepared documents like Process Design Document, Solution Design Document and Technical Design Document.•	Responsible for the overall testing cycles•	Deliver technical training, demos, blueprints and provide necessary support for new/existing clients.Desired Candidate Profile•	Graduate in Computer Science/IT or equivalent Degree•	3+ years of experience in IT industry with code development background•	Strong technical skills on UiPath, and end to end UiPath offerings•	Minimum of 1.5 years of experience in developing, implementing automation workflows in UiPath.•	Understanding of workflow-based logic and hands on experience with RE-framework.•	UiPath Advanced Developer Certification is a must.•	Excellent communication skill is a must•	Basic programming/Scripting knowledge on VBA/VB/java/C# script is must (or any scripting language, python is a plus)•	Knowledge in cognitive automation with OCR tools, AI/ML skills is a plus.•	Excellent software development background with any of the following (C#, C++, Java, .NET) is a plus•	Domain knowledge in BFSI or Healthcare or Insurance or Retail is a plus•	Experience working on other RPA tools/vendors is a plus•	Support experience in doing RCA analysis, Bug fixing, CR & Enhancement activities(NOTE: You may opt out of our talent community by sending us an email with OPT OUT at the start of the subject line. Or, in case you have applied in the past 6 months and would like to get feedback, please reply with the date of application and other details of the assessments you have completed.)

Job Title: Reporting and Analytics Developer - Permanent Night Shift
Job Description: Job Description   Minimum Requirements 5 to 10 years related experience. Excellent knowledge of data modeling, SQL and data warehousing. Experience in multiple database platforms including: SQL Server, Oracle and DB2. Strong knowledge of Microsoft BI technology (SSRS, SSIS, SSAS, Power BI) and otherreporting tools (IBM Cognos). Proficient building ETLs using SSIS and C# Experience with parsing data from APIs, XMLs, JSON and other non-relational datasources Skills and experience using Azure and AWS for BI applications are desirable. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Design and develop enterprise and departmental business intelligence, data warehousing and reportingsolutions. Work with business users to establish reporting and analytic requirements. Translate business requirements into ETL and report specifications. Develop and implement ETL processes, reports and queries in support of business analytics.Page 2 of 5HR Use Only – REV 04.26 – Software Developer Develop and implement interactive analytic reports and dashboards. Provide technical and business knowledge support to the team. Compile ad-hoc data and report requests. Performs advanced statistical analysis for projects and experiments. Performs and directs QA/testing of dev activities done on the Reporting and Analytics system. Performs coordination for tasks between other teams and team members. Must be able to review reports and draw conclusions.Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:Must Have1. In depth understanding of programming, modern software development process using TFS2. In depth understanding of relational database concepts and programming3. Proven ability to implement a solution from inception to production4. Significant experience and expertise on Microsoft .NET Framework, SSRS, SSIS, and C#5. Expertise on Microsoft SQL Server (preferably 2008 and up), TSQL, SSIS, SSAS6. Excellent analytical and troubleshooting skills7. Experience with Azure and AWS technologies in the context of BI solutionsShould have1. Experience with data warehousing, star schema, data analysis, service oriented architectures, webServices2. Experience with implementing complex scripting, SQL and C# to deliver business requirementsNice to have1. Experience in healthcare setting (provider/payer environment)2. Experience with other Business Intelligence tools like Birst, Power BI and others3. Experience with VS Team Server System (TFS)4. Experience with MVC, WCF, Entity Framework in C#5. Experience with unit testing tools/frameworks6. Experience with JIRA, Topdesk and other process tracking tools

Job Title: Group Brand Manager- Medical Equipment Company
Job Description: Job Description   1.	Proven working experience in marketing, preferably in the healthcare industry – with at least 10 years experience in a supervisory or managerial capacity.2.	An MBA is an advantage, but not necessary.3.	A technical background in the hospital industry is preferred.4.	Proficient in MS office applications.5. Willing to be assigned in Pasig/QC area.Competencies1.	Obtains and analyzes information about the market2.	Works collaboratively with other departments on behalf of the Principal3.	Manages and implements change as necessary4.	Formulates and leads execution of marketing strategies and action plans5.	Manages the brand – establishes its positioning and evaluates performance6.	Develops and delivers integrated marketing communications7.	Innovates value propositions leveraging on the brand’s and Company’s unique value proposition8.	Monitors the effectiveness of the marketing plan9.	Articulates the desired customer experience10.	Multi-tasks11.	Develops talents required for the delivery of departmental objectives Responsibilities1.	Assesses implementation and methods utilized, channels and sources of market research covering, but not limited to the following areas- current industry innovations and market requirements as well a technology updates and current products.2.	Analyzes customer buying habits in relation to product capability and aligns these to customer segments.Reviews current market segments and assesses market share against business goals. Works with the Sales business units in categorizing accounts to determine marketing strategy.3.	Evaluates new market-related opportunities through periodic fieldwork, working with the Sales business units, leveraging on the Company’s unique value proposition, to develop new markets or new products within the business unit.4.	Consolidates industry innovations, technology updates and market requirements into potential product offerings.5.	Monitors the competitive landscape, including both direct and indirect competitors, and updates the competitive profile matrix relevant to current and future market plans.6.	Follows through applicable sales leads through market coverage and maintaining close interactions with, but not limited to, end-users, technical specialists and certain key decision makers.7.	Ensures timely update of sales funnels in collaboration with the sales business units.8.	Reviews and consolidates integrated marketing communications plans such as product information, product introductions, promotions etc; which includes collaboration with principals and/or their representatives.9.	Analyzes impact of product demonstrations and product scripts in relation to demand creation action plans as reflected in sales funnels or ongoing projects.10.	Assesses and seeks final approval to the marketing plan.11.	Evaluates impact of the marketing plan according to agreed pricing, promotions and distribution strategies.12.	Determines product life cycle alignment to sales strategies- makes product (including product inventory management), pricing, promotions and distribution decisions accordingly.13.	Reviews results related to sales and operations planning both on quantitative and qualitative basis; endorses final purchasing and inventory plans.14.	Conducts win/loss analysis against marketing programs, product launch as well as all bid opportunities that may have been participated in, based on business unit goals.15.	Assesses need for conduct of product training across all segments – makes decisions regarding scheduling of product and applications specialists for product demos and technical training.16.	Analyzes and makes decisions regarding customer segment profit and loss.

Job Description: Job Description   Overview:In CoDev, you will be welcomed and be part of our team. We support your growth and learning by providing access to online courses and monthly developer meetups. Moreover, we value you and your family by providing competitive salary and healthcare insurance coverage.We have job vacancies for Mid to Senior level Java Developers. This is an opportunity to be part of one of our offshore clients. You'll get to collaborate with other technical talents locally and offshore.Our ideal candidate will have the desire to thrive in a collaborative, team-oriented environment, the ability to quickly learn and effectively apply new technologies and concepts, and the initiative to excel in high-performance work culture.Job Responsibilities:Develop software solutions by studying information needs; conferring with users; studying systems flow, data usage, and work processes; investigating problem areas; following the software development lifecycle.Design, implement, support, and maintain RESTful web services and APIs using Spring and HibernateDesign, implement, and support databases (specifically, MySQL)Design, implement and support user directoriesWork collaboratively with other teams (front-end development, Quality Assurance, UX/UI Design, etc.)Determine operational feasibility by evaluating analysis, problem definition, requirements, solution development, and proposed solutions.Document and demonstrate solutions by developing documentation, flowcharts, layouts, diagrams, charts, code comments and clear code.Prepare and install solutions by determining and designing system specifications, standards, and programming.Improve operations by conducting systems analysis; recommending changes in policies and procedures.Update job knowledge by studying state-of-the-art development tools, programming techniques, and computing equipment; participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; participating in professional organizations.Protect operations by keeping information confidential.Provide information by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing development and service issues.Accomplish engineering and organization mission by completing related results as needed.Support and develop peer engineers by providing advice, coaching and mentorship opportunities.Technical Qualifications: Requirements:4+ years of strong technical experience with the following: Java 8+, J2EE, Spring Boot 1.5+, Spring, Eclipse/HibernateSolid experience with relational databases including MySQL, MS SQL Server and PostgreSQLExperience with RESTful web services using JSONExperience working with Agile methodologies, in a Scrum environmentExperience with Configuration Management tools, specifically Git and JenkinsFull Stack experience using JavaScript strongly preferably Angular, Vue, or ReactAbove Average - Excellent communication skillsProven ability to work in a highly collaborative, team-oriented environment.Proven ability to work in deadline-driven environmentOther skills that are nice to have:DockerKubernetes / OpenShiftWebpackELK StackScalaApache Kafka / Hadoop / FlinkGoRabbitMQLogstashBenefitsGreat talent deserves even greater compensation. CoDev provides several benefits that you can enjoy as soon as you join our growing team. We take pride in delighting you with what you deserve.Anticipate a regularization increase on your 6th month.One Time Client Placement Bonus of Php 15,000.Client Retention Incentives amounting to Php 30,000.Annual salary increase based on your performance.Tax-Free allowances incorporated in your pay.Employee health is our top priority, so everyone gets a Medical and Life Insurance package on your 3rd month with us plus 2 dependents.We offer salary loans with 0% interest, payable in 2 months.Provide an opportunity for self-improvements like access to online training sites such as Udemy, Pluralsight, and other resources. Plus, training reimbursement to the online course or program you choose!Leave credits you can enjoy for vacation and travels with family because we believe that work-life balance matters!Company events and parties such as our huge Anniversary and Christmas Parties, and of course seasonal events such as Valentines, Halloween and so many more.Team outing and lunches every now and then to promote camaraderie in the team.Sports tournaments such as basketball, badminton, foosball, etc. are held yearly so you can showcase your sporty side!Access to social media sites like Facebook, Youtube, Instagram and etc. on a given time.Express yourself by showcasing your sense of style at the office. Also, wear your most comfortable and lazy ootd every last shift of the week.

or feature enhancements to existing systems.Contributes to the provision of enterprise-grade solutions:Performs full life cycle software development of distributed web applications.Designs and develop processes.Meets or exceeds milestones and deliverable dates for the assigned tasks.Manages and maintains an excellent and professional relationship with internal and external stakeholders and always
